title: List of municipalities in British Columbia
summary: British Columbia is the third-most populous province in Canada, with 4,648,055 residents as of 2016, and is the second-largest in land area,[lower-alpha 1] at 922,503 km2 (356,180 sq mi).[2] British Columbia's 162 municipalities cover only 11 percent of the province's land mass yet are home to 89 percent of its population. A municipality is a local government incorporated by the province allowing a community to govern itself and to provide and regulate local services. These services typically include, but are not limited to, the provision of drinking water, sewers, roads, fire protection, street lights, garbage/recycling collection, land use planning, building inspection, and parks.
